script: Ever tried to remember a story word by word? That’s what RNNs do! They’re neural networks that remember past data, like reading a sentence and predicting the next word. Imagine a detective piecing together clues—each new clue helps them guess what happened next. RNNs work the same way, analyzing sequences in speech or text. Why does this matter? Because they power voice assistants, translate languages, and even predict stock trends. Without RNNs, AI wouldn’t understand context—just like a detective without clues!
